meanings.definition: In the direction of or toward a pole.
meanings.sent1: The explorers traveled poleward to reach the icy Arctic region.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle pointed poleward, indicating the way north.
meanings.sent3: The penguins waddled poleward, eager to explore the chilly lands.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled poleward, carrying the whispers of the frozen wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The ship sailed poleward, cutting through the frigid waters with determination.

meanings.definition: Situated or existing toward a pole.
meanings.sent1: The poleward regions of the Earth experience long periods of darkness in winter.
meanings.sent2: The polar bears are well-adapted to the poleward climates of the Arctic.
meanings.sent3: The poleward-facing windows offered stunning views of the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent4: The poleward shift in climate patterns is affecting the habitats of many species.
meanings.sent5: The poleward migration of birds signals the changing of seasons.
